content.question:
<math alttext="The figure shows a 5 row table with 2 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The heading for row 3 is “f prime of x.” The heading for row 4 is “f double prime of x.” The heading for row 5 is “f triple prime of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1: x is negative 1; f of x is 10; f prime of x is negative 1; f double prime of x is 23; f triple prime of x is negative 42. Column 2: x is 1; f of x is 0; f prime of x is negative 9; f double prime of x is negative 13; f triple prime of x is 6." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable columnlines="solid" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>10</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>′</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>23</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>13</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>42</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>
The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> has derivatives of all orders for all real numbers. The table shown gives values of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> and its first three derivatives at selected values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>. What is the value of <math alttext="the integral from negative 1 to 1, of, f double prime of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
